intro: Echinospermum lappula var. squarrosum, commonly known as the rough lappula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a schizocarp composed of two winged mericarps, which are distinctive in appearance. This variety is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
